Whether choosing a name for a newborn, graduating from grade school, getting a driver’s license, applying for a job, or seeking approval for a film script, if you live in Iran, you best come fluent in Orwellian discourse. Progressing along a rough timeline from birth to death, each story is shot in a static camera angle as a single petitioner negotiates with an authority figure hovering just outside of frame, who is practiced in the language of doublespeak.","poster_path":"/bfQkqoPXUrWLxDmt71LYWp5A2uZ.jpg","media_type":"movie","adult":false,"original_language":"fa","genre_ids":[18,35],"popularity":14.184,"release_date":"2023-10-05","video":false,"vote_average":7.2,"vote_count":28},{"backdrop_path":"/i8PoujNA5qbsHAGZkG1IheqiP2i.jpg","id":1119546,"title":"Dear Paris","original_title":"Paradis Paris","overview":"What makes life worth living?
